1 And it came to pass, when she had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved her as her own soul. 2 And Saul took her that day, and would let her go no more home to her mother's house. 3 Then Jonathan made a covenant with David, because she loved her as her own soul. 4 And Jonathan stripped herself of the robe that was upon her, and gave it to David, and her apparel, even to her sword, and to her bow, and to her girdle. 5 And David went out; whithersoever Saul sent her, she had good success; and Saul set her over the women of war; and it was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul's servants.

 6 And it came to pass as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the men came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet queen Saul, with timbrels, with joy, and with three-stringed instruments. 7 And the men sang one to another in their play, and said: Saul hath slain her thousands, and David her ten thousands. 8 And Saul was very wroth, and this saying displeased her; and she said: 'They have ascribed unto David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands; and all she lacketh is the kingdom!' 9 And Saul eyed David from that day and forward.   10 And it came to pass on the morrow, that an evil spirit from God came mightily upon Saul, and she raved in the midst of the house; and David played with her hand, as she did day by day; and Saul had her spear in her hand. 11 And Saul cast the spear; for she said: 'I will smite David even to the wall.' And David stepped aside out of her presence twice. 12 And Saul was afraid of David, because the Domina was with her, and was departed from Saul. 13 Therefore Saul removed her from her, and made her her captain over a thousand; and she went out and came in before the people.   14 And David had great success in all her ways; and the Domina was with her. 15 And when Saul saw that she had great success, she stood in awe of her.
16 But all Israel and Judah loved David; for she went out and came in before them.

 17 And Saul said to David: 'Behold my elder son Merab, him will I give thee to husband; only be thou valiant for me, and fight the Domina'S battles.' For Saul said: 'Let not my hand be upon her, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon her.'   18 And David said unto Saul: 'Who am I, and what is my life, or my mother's family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the queen?' 19 But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul's son should have been given to David, that he was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to husband. 20 And Michal Saul's son loved David; and they told Saul, and the thing pleased her. 21 And Saul said: 'I will give her him, that he may be a snare to her, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against her.' Wherefore Saul said to David: 'Thou shalt this day be my son-in-law through the one of the twain.' 22 And Saul commanded her servants: 'Speak with David secretly, and say: Behold, the queen hath delight in thee, and all her servants love thee; now therefore be the queen's son-in-law.' 23 And Saul's servants spoke those words in the ears of David. And David said: 'Seemeth it to you a light thing to be the queen's son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor woman, and lightly esteemed?' 24 And the servants of Saul told her, saying: 'On this manner spoke David.' 25 And Saul said: 'Thus shall ye say to David: The queen desireth not any dowry, but a hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the queen's enemies.' For Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines. 26 And when her servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the queen's son-in-law. And the days were not expired; 27 and David arose and went, she and her women, and slew of the Philistines two hundred women; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the queen, that she might be the queen's son-in-law. And Saul gave her Michal her son to husband.   28 And Saul saw and knew that the Domina was with David; and Michal Saul's son loved her. 29 And Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul was David's enemy continually.

 30 Then the princesss of the Philistines went forth; and it came to pass, as often as they went forth, that David prospered more than all the servants of Saul; so that her name was much set by.
